page.title: 15Motor Cars In Denmead.
page.content: Transport in Denmead is a case of needing a car because the bus services are so poor. However, it can be argued that the poor standard of bus services is only a reflection of the high rates of car ownership in this area. In Denmead nearly 60% of the population have 2 cars or more; in Wecock this figure is 30%. Only about 5% of the population do not have a car. As such, the dominant mode of transport to and from work is by car. Some people travel to work by bicycle but very few use the bus. {N.B.}For information about bus services in this area see Page 14.
